section1.title: 1. Purpose of donorHub
section1.text:
donorHub is a cryptocurrency-driven donation platform designed to connect individuals with charitable causes worldwide. Our mission is to make giving easy, transparent, and rewarding by allowing donors to contribute and participate in prize pools.

Whether you're looking to support humanitarian projects, environmental conservation, education, or any other cause, donorHub ensures that your contributions are securely processed and reach their intended recipients. Prize pools are an added feature to incentivize donors, combining philanthropy with engagement.

section2.title: 2. Eligibility
section2.text1: To use donorHub, you must meet the following requirements:
section2.li1: You are at least 18 years old or the legal age of majority in your country.
section2.li2: You agree to provide accurate and complete information during the donation process.
section2.li3: You are not prohibited by law from making cryptocurrency transactions in your jurisdiction.
section2.text2: donorHub reserves the right to terminate accounts or restrict access if any eligibility criteria are violated.

section3.title: 3. User Accounts (if applicable)
section3.text1: If user accounts are available or introduced in the future, they will be subject to the following terms:
section3.li1: Choose a secure and unique password.
section3.li2: Keep your login credentials confidential and secure.
section3.li3: Ensure that all account information is current and accurate to avoid disruptions.
section3.text2: In case of unauthorized account access or suspicious activity, notify donorHub immediately. We will not be liable for any losses or damages caused by your failure to maintain account security.

section4.title: 4. Donations and Prize Pools
section4.text1: Donations made through donorHub are final, non-refundable, and processed through secure blockchain networks. Prize pools offer users the chance to win rewards, subject to the following conditions:
section4.li1: Each prize pool specifies entry requirements, deadlines, and rules.
section4.li2: Winners are selected fairly, either via blockchain mechanisms or secure randomizers.
section4.li3: Prize distribution may be subject to verification processes and adherence to the pool's terms.
section4.text2: By participating in prize pools, you acknowledge the inherent risks of cryptocurrency transactions, including fluctuations in value and transaction fees.

section5.title: 5. Cryptocurrency Transactions
section5.text1: All transactions on donorHub are processed on blockchain networks. This ensures security and transparency but may also lead to:
section5.li1: Irreversible transactions once confirmed on the blockchain.
section5.li2: Delays caused by network congestion or wallet errors.
section5.li3: Responsibility for inputting correct wallet addresses lies solely with the user.
section5.text2: donorHub is not liable for losses arising from user errors or network issues. Always double-check transaction details before proceeding.

section6.title: 6. User Responsibilities
section6.text1: Users must adhere to the following guidelines when using donorHub:
section6.li1: Refrain from illegal activities, including fraud, money laundering, or tax evasion.
section6.li2: Respect the intellectual property of others.
section6.li3: Avoid submitting harmful, misleading, or offensive content.
section6.text2: Violations may result in account suspension, legal action, or other consequences.

section7.title: 7. Data Privacy
section7.text: donorHub collects and processes your data in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Your data will never be sold or shared with third parties without consent unless required by law.

section8.title: 8. Liability Disclaimer
section8.text: donorHub provides services "as is" without guarantees. We disclaim all warranties, and our liability is limited to the maximum extent permitted by law.

faq.pageTitleText: Here you will find answers to the most common questions.

q1.q: 1. What is the purpose of this FAQ section?
q1.a: This FAQ section is designed to provide answers to the most common questions from our users about the DonorHub platform. It explains the process of entering donation pools, winning prizes, and how everything works behind the scenes, including the role of smart contracts.

q2.q: 2. How do I enter a pool?
q2.a: To enter a pool, simply click the "Donate now" button. A modal will appear asking you to connect your wallet. Choose your decentralized wallet app (like MetaMask or similar), and confirm the connection. Once connected, send your transaction from the wallet, either via desktop or mobile app, and wait for the confirmation. Once the transaction is confirmed, you're entered into the pool!

q3.a: If you need assistance, you can either fill out the contact form or email us directly at contact@donorhub.site.

q4.q: 4. What is the entry process for a pool?
q4.a: Each donation into a pool counts as a "ticket," and you can only enter once per session. However, you can enter multiple times for the same pool if you like. The pool entries are managed transparently by a Smart Contract (SC), ensuring fairness and transparency throughout the process.

q5.q: 5. How is the winner selected for a pool?
q5.a: There is only one winner per pool, and the winner is determined automatically by the smart contract, based on certain conditions. The winner will be selected when the gas price is reasonable; if it's a "rush hour," the transaction might be delayed until the gas price is more favorable. This process is fully automated, with no manual intervention.

q6.a: Currently, there is no limit to the number of pools you can participate in. You can enter as many pools as you like!

q7.a: Each completed pool will display the Ethereum address of the winner. This information is visible to everyone, but only the winner's address is displayed, not their identity. This ensures transparency while maintaining user anonymity.

q8.q: 8. Are there any legal or tax implications for winning?
q8.a: This depends on the country in which you reside. We do not take responsibility for tax obligations or legal requirements regarding winnings. Please check your local laws to understand any obligations you might have.

q9.q: 9. Do I have an account on DonorHub?
q9.a: Currently, users do not have individual accounts. Instead, each user is represented by their Ethereum address. If a user owns multiple addresses, each address can participate in pools separately. In rare cases, if a pool is full, the smart contract will attempt to reward the Ethereum address with the prize, but this depends on gas prices. If it's a high-demand period ("rush hour"), the transaction may be delayed until gas prices are favorable. Users will be notified through their wallet (e.g., MetaMask).

q10.q: 10. How many winners are there per pool?
q10.a: There is only one winner per pool, and the winner is automatically selected based on the smart contract's logic. This process is entirely transparent.

q11.q: 11. Are there any limits to how many pools I can enter?
q11.a: Currently, there is no limit to how many pools you can enter. You are free to participate in as many pools as you want.

q12.q: 12. Will I be able to withdraw my prize?
q12.a: There is no withdrawal process for users. If you win, the smart contract (SC) will automatically transfer your winnings directly to your Ethereum address.

q13.q: 13. How do I check my past wins?
q13.a: In the future, we plan to add a section where you can view all transactions and winning pools for an Ethereum address that has participated in at least one pool.

q14.q: 14. How can I create my own pool?
q14.a: To create a pool, please provide the details via our contact form, and we will assist you in setting it up. Make sure to include all relevant information and requirements for your pool.

q15.a: All transactions on DonorHub are completely anonymous. The only information we have is your Ethereum address, which is used for transparency in selecting winners. We do not track who owns the address.

q16.q: 16. Is there a time limit for a pool to reach its target?
q16.a: No, there is no time limit for a pool to reach its target. Funds will remain on the network until the pool is full, ensuring that users have enough time to participate.

q17.q: 17. How does the Smart Contract work?
q17.a: The Smart Contract (SC) is fully transparent and controls the entire pool entry process. It ensures fairness in selecting winners, handling entries, and distributing prizes. All transactions are executed according to the rules specified by the contract.

q18.q: 18. Can I donate to a pool without participating in the drawing?
q18.a: Currently, donations are only linked to pool entries. If you donate to a pool, you are automatically entered into the drawing. Donations are not accepted without participation in the pool.
